definitions.definition: To persist in opposition or resistance (against something); to refuse to comply (with someone).
To be obvious or conspicuous, in contrast to the surroundings.
definitions.example: Tourist guides often carry umbrellas so that they stand out in a crowd.

definitions.definition: To be extraordinary and different or to have features and qualities which make someone or something special.
definitions.example: She stood out from the other candidates and was offered the job.

definitions.definition: To sail in a direction away from shore.
